page.title: 14MORWELLHAM POWER STATION
page.content: There is a small{Hydro-electric}power station at{Morwellham.}It was opened in 1934 and uses the water from the Tavistock Canal.20,000 tons of mud was removed from the disused canal and a new 135ft tunnel had to be made to bring the water to the station. There are two 500 horse-power turbines which produce 11,000 volts of electricity.8,000,000,000 gallons of water a year pass through the station into the river Tamar. Every year the canal is emptied for cleaning and the big pipes have to be cleared of rubbish. l8 people work at the Station but most of the time it runs on its own.
